III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Section qualifications.
Description
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member was having a sexual relationship with a youth
when they resided at the facility.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 04/21/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A’s Mother gave permission to interview Youth A by phone
on 04/28/2025 since she was discharged from Wayne County
Juvenile Detention on 04/07/2025. Youth A stated Staff 1 was
“cool” and she did not have concerns about Staff 1. Youth A was
asked if there were boundary concerns with Staff 1. Youth A
stated Staff 1 noticed dandruff in Youth A’s hair when she walked
past Youth A, who sat in a chair in the classroom. Youth A stated
she asked Staff 1 to remove the dandruff and Staff 1 agreed.
Youth A stated a few minutes later a movie started and Youth A
moved to sit on the ground. Youth A stated Staff 1 sat in a chair
behind Youth A and continued to work on Youth A’s dandruff.
Youth A stated Staff 1 “got in trouble” with Team Lead “for
scratching my head”. Youth A stated this incident occurred once
in 02/2025. Another Department of Health and Human Service
(DHHS) Worker attended Youth A’s Kids Talk on 06/04/2025.
DHHS Worker stated Youth A denied sexual boundary issues
with Staff 1 and Staff 2.
Youth B was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention because she was identified by Former Youth
as a witness. Youth B stated she knows Youth A. Youth B stated
Staff 1 is one of her favorite staff and did not have concerns with
her. Youth B stated she did not recall a time when Staff 1 worked
on Youth A’s hair or scalp. Youth B stated she was done talking
and her interview was finished.
Former Youth was interviewed on 04/28/2025 by phone. Former
Youth stated Staff 1 had Youth A sit between her legs in the
2

classroom and the position was inappropriate. Former Youth
stated this occurred one time. Former Youth stated Team Lead
addressed this with Staff 1. Former Youth did not have additional
concerns or details about this incident. Former Youth stated there
are no boundary concerns between Youth A and Staff 2.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 05/08/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Staff 1 stated she noticed heavy dandruff in Youth A’s
hair and told her. Staff 1 stated Youth A asked her to get the
dandruff out and she agreed. Staff 1 stated she sat in a chair and
Youth A sat on the ground in between her legs while Staff 1
worked on getting dandruff patches off Youth A’s scalp and out of
her hair. Staff 1 stated Team Lead spoke with her afterwards and
told her that staff are not to groom youth’s hair. Staff 1 stated she
understands that she should have referred Youth A to health
services or to a beautician instead of handling Youth A’s dandruff
herself. Staff 1 stated this incident occurred several months ago
and she did not write an incident report.
Team Lead was interviewed on 05/01/2025 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Team Lead stated she spoke with Staff 1
about scratching dandruff out of Youth A’s hair. Team Lead
stated Staff 1 recognized the possible boundary concern and
stated moving forward she would not do it again and it has not
occurred.
Video
Video is not available because the incident occurred in 02/2025.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention video footage is available for
review up to 30 days after the incident.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. The interviews do not
suggest sexual grooming or sexual intention when Staff 1 sat in a
chair with Youth A sitting on the ground and removed dandruff
from Youth A’s scalp and hair.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
